column5: I just got back from Canadian Tire and looking through the fishing stuff noticed these lures that look like fish nothing unusual till you read the package and discover they have a blinking light in their belly. Are these new or am I showing my greener side here again?

Those ones do work. If you know who Boyd Duckett is, he caught his fish on a Laser Lure during this years CLASSIC. They definately work, the real ones are expensive. Here is a link.  http://www.basstackledepot.com/laser-lure-...crankbaits.aspx  There are tonnes of them available. I have seen at CT and Walmart.  Dirk

been around for a while now. has a blinking red light in them to imitate and "blood" trail to trigger strikes. do they really work..?? no clue, if they have a good swimming action, i assume they would catch fish, may be just a gimmick though. who knows. who cares lol
Bought one last year from Wally world as a laff...got one fish at night on it...thats it.
They might work for salmon fishing off piers at night. Never tried it tho
